intro: Pyrenacantha humblotii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in umbels, and its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
